description: HUNTINGTON - The Cabell County Commission and Huntington City Council approved expense and excess levy rates for the 2018-19 fiscal year during special meetings Tuesday. The rates are set...
title: Cabell, Huntington approve levy rates, unchanged for FY 2019
title_page: Cabell, Huntington approve levy rates, unchanged for FY 2019
maintext:
HUNTINGTON - The Cabell County Commission and Huntington City Council approved expense and excess levy rates for the 2018-19 fiscal year during special meetings Tuesday.
The rates are set every year and, by state law, must be set at a special meeting on the third Tuesday in April.
No one from the public made any objections to the property taxation rates at either of the meetings.
Cabell County levy rates
County Administrator Beth Thompson said the county levy rates were unchanged and have remained the same for several years.
The rates are broken down into four categories, but only three of them affect property owners in the county. Class II properties, which are all residential units in the county, are taxed 28.60 cents per $100 assessed valuation on each property. Class III properties, which are all commercial businesses outside municipalities, and Class IV properties, which are all commercial businesses inside municipalities, are both taxed 57.20 cents.
Total projected property tax collection from properties inside the county are about $14.5 million, which makes up the majority of the county’s revenue.
The commission also laid the rates for the excess levy funds. Class II properties are taxed 13.58 cents per $100 assessed on each property. Class III and Class IV properties are taxed 27.16 cents.
The excess levies raise funds for Cabell County Emergency Medical Services, the Cabell-Huntington Health Department, fire protection services and training, economic development, Green Acres Regional Center and Autism Services Center, and Cabell County senior citizen projects and programs.
Thompson said the county’s regular levy has been maxed out for years; however, they still have about $300,000 in levying authority left with the excess levy before it reaches its max.
State law requires that excess levy rates cannot be more than half of the property taxation rates.
Huntington levy rates
The levy rates for the city of Huntington also remained unchanged and at their max.
Class II properties are taxed at 22 cents per $100 assessed on each property and Class IV properties are taxed 44 cents.
Total projected property tax collection from properties inside Huntington is just over $5 million.
Approved excess levy rates for Huntington are 7 cents per $100 of property tax value for Class II and 14 cents for Class IV.
Total projected property tax collection for the excess levies, which subsidizes operations at the Tri-State Transit Authority, is about $1.6 million.
The 2018-19 fiscal year begins July 1, 2018, and ends June 30, 2019.
